nodes.documentation:
@author Karen Suen
@notice A proxy contract for interacting with low-level contracts.
All client interactions should use this contract to modify the state
of the marketplace (create, access, modify listings and transactions)
In practice, this proxy contract should have "ownership" of the low level
contracts to ensure only this contract can invoke their methods by manually
implementing ownership checks or using the OpenZeppelin Ownable contract.
To reduce gas cost, business logic is implemented in the client app.
This proxy contract can be replaced to support upgradability without losing
the current data stored in the contract which is maintained by MarketStore
and Escrow. Listings are never removed, use INACTIVE state to disable listings.
nodes.name: Market

nodes.documentation:
@notice Event for notifying about a new listing
@param id Id of the new listing
nodes.name: ListingCreated

nodes.documentation:
@notice Event for notifying about an existing listing being disabled
@param id Id of the disabled listing
nodes.name: ListingDisabled

nodes.documentation:
@notice Event for notifying about a selling a listing
@param id Id of the sold listing
nodes.name: ListingSold

nodes.documentation:
@dev Constructor initialises instances of low-level storage contracts for
this proxy contract using the given contract addresses.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256,string memory,string memory,string memory,address) external returns (uint256)

nodes.name: createListing
buyListing
confirmItemReceived
disableListing

nodes.documentation:

@return Total number of listings

@dev Constructor initialises instances of low-level storage contracts for

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256,string memory,string memory,string memory,address) external returns (uint256)

nodes.name: createListing
buyListing
confirmItemReceived
disableListing

nodes.documentation:
@dev Retrieve total number of listings ever stored in the marketplace
@return Total number of listings
nodes.name: getTotalListings
getAllSellerListings

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) view external returns (uint256,uint256,string memory,string memory,string memory,address,uint256)

nodes.name: getListing
getListingPrice
getListingTitle
getListingDescription
getListingImage
getListingSeller
getListingStatus
getAllUserTransactionIds
getTransaction
getTransactionStatus
getTransactionBuyer
getTransactionSeller
getTransactionAmount

buyListing(uint256).details: Sender of this function purchases the given listing and sends the purchase funds to be held in escrow. This function assumes the correct amount of funds are sent and the listing exists so safety checks should be implemented by the client app.

params._listingId: The listing id to purchase with funds

confirmItemReceived(uint256).details: Updates a transaction to confirmed status, triggering release of buyer's purchase funds to the seller and completing the trade.

params._transactionId: The id of listing to update

constructor.details: Constructor initialises instances of low-level storage contracts for this proxy contract using the given contract addresses.

createListing(uint256,string,string,stri.details: Create a new listing in the marketplace and notifies client with the new listing id through event. Sender of this function is assumed to be the seller of the listing.

params._image: The reference for accessing the image from a distributed database
params._price: The selling price of listing in Wei
params._title: The title of the listing and item for sale

disableListing(uint256).details: Updates a listing to disabled status to indicate it is no longer available for sale.

params._listingId: The id of listing to update

getAllSellerListings(address).details: Retrieves a list of all listings created by the given address

params._seller: User address to get all listings for

getAllSellerListings(address).return: A list of all listing ids created by the user

getAllUserTransactionIds(address).details: Returns a list of all transactions involving the given user address

getListing(uint256).details: Retrieves all information about a listing as a tuple. Note, the listing status is returned as an integer: 0 = AVAILABLE, 1 = SOLD, 2 = INACTIVE
getListing(uint256).return: Listing id, price in wei, title, description, image reference, seller address, status

getListingDescription(uint256).details: Returns the reference to the description of the given listing id stored in a distributed database.

getListingImage(uint256).details: Returns the reference to the image of the given listing id stored in a distributed database.

getListingPrice(uint256).details: Returns the selling price of the given listing id.

getListingSeller(uint256).details: Returns the seller address of the given listing id.

getListingStatus(uint256).details: Returns the status of a listing as an integer: 0 = AVAILABLE, 1 = SOLD, 2 = INACTIVE

getListingTitle(uint256).details: Returns the title of the given listing id.

getTotalListings().details: Retrieve total number of listings ever stored in the marketplace

getTransaction(uint256).details: Returns all information about a transaction as a tuple. Note, the transaction status is returned as an integer: 0 = AWAITING_PAYMENT, 1 = AWAITING_DELIVERY, 2 = CONFIRMED
getTransaction(uint256).return: Transaction status, buyer address, seller address, transaction amount

getTransactionAmount(uint256).details: Returns the amount of funds (to be) held in escrow of the given transaction id

getTransactionBuyer(uint256).details: Returns the buyer address of the given transaction id

getTransactionSeller(uint256).details: Returns the seller address of the given transaction id

getTransactionStatus(uint256).details: Returns the status of the given transaction id as an integer: 0 = AWAITING_PAYMENT, 1 = AWAITING_DELIVERY, 2 = CONFIRMED

userdoc.notice: A proxy contract for interacting with low-level contracts. All client interactions should use this contract to modify the state of the marketplace (create, access, modify listings and transactions) In practice, this proxy contract should have "ownership" of the low level contracts to ensure only this contract can invoke their methods by manually implementing ownership checks or using the OpenZeppelin Ownable contract. To reduce gas cost, business logic is implemented in the client app. This proxy contract can be replaced to support upgradability without losing the current data stored in the contract which is maintained by MarketStore and Escrow. Listings are never removed, use INACTIVE state to disable listings.
